body.class: mediawiki ltr ns-6 ns-subject page-File_Flag_of_Portugal_svg skin-vector

img.alt: File:Flag of Portugal.svg

div.p: Flag_of_Portugal.svg‎ (SVG file, nominally 600 × 400 pixels, file size: 63 KB)

This is a file from the Wikimedia Commons. Information from its description page there is shown below.
Commons is a freely licensed media file repository. You can help.

a.title: This is a file from the Wikimedia Commons

img.alt: This is a file from the Wikimedia Commons

div.div: English: Flag of Portugal, created by Columbano Bordalo Pinheiro (1857-1929), officially adopted by Portuguese government in June 30th 1911 (in use since about November 1910).
Português: Bandeira de Portugal, criada por Columbano Bordalo Pinheiro (1857-1929), adotada oficialmente pelo governo português em 30 de junho de 1911 (em uso desde novembro de 1910).
div.p: Color shades matching the officially reccomended RGB values here.
(PMS values should be used for direct ink or textile; CMYK for 4-color offset printing on paper; this is an image for screen display, RGB should be used.)
The original of this vector set was contracted by the Portuguese Presidential Office in June 2004 to Vítor Luís Rodrigues and António Martins-Tuválkin expressly to be released in public domain.

table.style: width:100%; clear:both; margin:0.5em auto; background-color:#f7f8ff; border:2px solid #8888aa; direction: ltr;

img.alt: Public domain

span.i: This image (or other media file) is in the public domain because its copyright has expired.
This applies to the United States, Australia, the European Union and those countries with a copyright term of life of the author plus 70 years.

small.span: Note that a few countries have copyright terms longer than 70 years: Mexico has 100 years, Colombia has 80 years, and Guatemala and Samoa have 75 years. This image may not be in the public domain in these countries, which moreover do not implement the rule of the shorter term. Côte d'Ivoire has a general copyright term of 99 years and Honduras has 75 years, but they do implement the rule of the shorter term.

table.style: width:100%; clear:both; margin:0.5em auto; background-color:#f7f8ff; border:2px solid #8888aa; direction:ltr;

td.span: This image shows a flag, a coat of arms, a seal or some other official insignia. The use of such symbols is restricted in many countries. These restrictions are independent of the copyright status.

span.small: This tag does not indicate the copyright status or the source of the attached work. A normal copyright tag and a source are still required. See Commons:Licensing for more information.

p.span: Alemannisch | Boarisch | Български | Català | Česky | Dansk | Deutsch | Ελληνικά | English | Esperanto | Español | Eesti | Euskara | Suomi | Français | Hrvatski | Magyar | Bahasa Indonesia | Italiano | 日本語 | ქართული | 한국어 | Lietuvių | Македонски | മലയാളം | Plattdüütsch | Nederlands | Polski | Português | Română | Русский | ไทย | Українська | Vèneto | Tiếng Việt | 中文 | ‪中文(简体)‬ | ‪中文(繁體)‬ | 粵語 | +/−

div.p: Click on a date/time to view the file as it appeared at that time.

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 05:57, 20 September 2010

td.span: (Reverted to version as of 01:40, 11 September 2010)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 05:03, 11 March 2010

td.span: (Alright, finally got an EPS viewing program, using the colors directly from the file.)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 19:22, 6 February 2010

td.span: (I did open the file and it does not show what you said it does. It gives me lighter colors than what we had, but not by much. Here is what the site eps file gives me.)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 15:30, 6 February 2010

td.span: (Download this file (http://www.presidencia.pt/archive/doc/BandeiraNacionalEPS.zip) from the official site of the Portuguese Presidency, unzip it, open it with Photoshop, and you will see a darker green.)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 04:20, 6 February 2010

td.span: (Reverted to version as of 21:43, 4 February 2010 (but according to the PT Government website which you cited before, RGB should be used for screens))

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 18:45, 5 February 2010

td.span: (Bluedenim, look at this picture: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Handover_Ceremony_of_Macau_Government.jpg. As you can see, the green in the the flag used in this oficial cerimony is darker. )

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 21:43, 4 February 2010

td.span: (Dark green is: 0-102-0. Red is: 255-0-0. )

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 19:45, 4 February 2010

td.span: (According to the official site of the Portuguese Presidency (http://www.presidencia.pt/?idc=44) the flag of Portugal is divided into DARK green (verde escuro) and red (escarlate). The green color in the previous file was too light, so I reverted the file )

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 16:40, 3 February 2010

td.span: (the source for this version is the best that one could get. A flag isn't a fashion item. It doesn't matter if it "looks good" or if it "looks bad".)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 15:26, 3 February 2010

td.span: (Reverted to version as of 22:11, 28 November 2009 other version better)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 23:46, 19 January 2010

td.span: (Color shades matching the officially reccomended RGB values [http://web.archive.org/web/20060306100913/http://presidenciarepublica.pt/pt/republica/simbolos/bandeiras/ here]. {{Information |Description= |Source=*File:Flag_of_Portugal.svg |Date=2010-)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 22:11, 28 November 2009

td.span: (Cloning a lot of elements, got rid of some hidden SVG elements)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 13:11, 11 June 2009

td.span: (Reverted to version as of 15:59, 24 September 2006)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 18:50, 23 March 2008

td.span: ((Modificado de acordo com os [http://jorgesampaio.arquivo.presidencia.pt/pt/republica/simbolos/bandeiras/index.html valores RGB recomendados originalmente]. Slightly changed the tones to match the [http://jorgesampaio.arquivo.presidencia.pt/pt/republica/)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 15:59, 24 September 2006

td.span: (cleaned up)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 12:07, 7 February 2006

td.span: (slightly changed the tones to match the recommended Pantone colours at http://presidenciarepublica.pt/pt/republica/simbolos/bandeiras/)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 09:38, 29 January 2006

td.span: (colours based on http://presidenciarepublica.pt/pt/republica/simbolos/bandeiras/)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 01:42, 28 December 2005

td.span: (more accurate version, converted from http://presidenciarepublica.pt/pt/republica/simbolos/bandeiras/ by User:Reisio)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 23:31, 24 November 2005

td.span: (Flag of Portugal from the [http://openclipart.org/ Open Clip Art] website. {{PD-OpenClipart}} Category:SVG flags)
